dialogue.text: I tap on Makoto’s name in my phone and wait for her to answer.
I figure that the two of us know each other well enough at this point that it will be fine for me to start inviting her over.
Of course, there is one glaring issue with that- and its name begins with the letter A.
If you said Alexander Graham Bell...you’d be wrong.
Because the answer is Ami.
Ami is the glaring issue.
Hello?
Hey, Makoto. What are you up to?
I’m just getting ready for work. Why? Did something happen?
Why are you assuming something happened?
Well, you know I have work, so I doubt you’d be calling to invite me over or something.
Does that mean you can’t come?
Wait, wha-?!
I can hear a stack of things falling over in the background. Probably books because Makoto is a smart girl who loves to read and learn.
You...You’re inviting me over?!
I am. Are you able to get your mom to cover for you or something?
Um...uhh! Hold on! I’ll go check!
The sound of things falling over is quickly replaced by the sound of Makoto stomping up the stairs to where I imagine her mother is.
This must be the case because there is no other discernible reason for her to be using stairs right now.
Mom! I need you to watch the store!
I...have to study!
What? Can’t you just study in the shop? That’s what you always do.
Not today! Today is...different!
But I’m so tiiiiiiiiiiiiired~
Mom! Please!
...UGH OKAY.
I should probably take inventory anyway...
THANK YOU.
Makoto quickly runs back down (Or up? Probably down) the stairs before bringing the phone back to her ear.
*Ahem*
Sensei? It appears that I will be able to come over after all.
As it turns out, I wasn’t even scheduled to work tonight. What a wonderful coincidence.
But I just heard-
Can you send me your address please?
I can probably find it if I check the[school]-register, but this way seems a lot less weird.
Yes. {i}A lot{/i} less weird.
And also, expect a fight when you get there.
...Is that code for roleplay or something?
I knew it was strange that you were inviting me over out of nowhere.
No, I just mean that I can’t imagine Ami will take kindly to seeing you in the house.
I see.
Should I bring a weapon?
Do you...own a weapon?
I can find one.
Uhh, no. I think it’s fine.
Just...come over whenever you’re ready.
Will do! See you soon!
I hang up the phone and start making my way home.
It would be pretty horrible if Makoto gets there first, so I need to...prep Ami in the meantime.
I’m back...
Oh, welcome home!
Would you like dinner now? Or perhaps a bath instead?
Or maybe...your freedom?
None of the above.
Aww, Sensei~ That’s so-
Wait, what?!
Ami, how much do you love me?
Obviously a lot!
Then I’m going to need you to listen very carefully.
Is something going on?...You’re scaring me.
It’s only going to get worse.
Should I...sit down?
No. Stay right there.
What I am about to say is going to shock you. But I need you to know that it won’t change anything between us. Okay?
Um...yeah...Of course.
Are you sure everything is-
Sometime in the next few minutes-
Makoto is coming over.
What?
Now, I need you to stay calm-
It’s so we can kill her, right?
You’d obviously never be stupid enough to invite {i}her{/i} to {i}our house{/i} unless it was to give me an early Christmas present...RIGHT?
It’s...to study.
To {i}study{/i}? Do you really think I’m going to buy that? You’re barely even a teacher.
No, I mean it. It’s just...for {i}me{/i} to study...Not her.
I decide to say the first thing that comes to mind.
Realistically, I probably could have just lied and told Ami that we were having the house fumigated or something and made her go back to the dorm but...
Well, where’s the fun in that?
So, let me get this straight...
You invited Makoto over to {i}our house{/i} because {i}you{/i} apparently need help {i}studying{/i}?
Yes. And what’s with all of the italics?
Does it make you feel weak? Needing the help of a [teenage]girl?
You and I both know that Makoto is no normal [teenage]girl. She’s superhuman.
More like super-stupid.
Good one.
Oh good. That must be the superhuman.
Why don’t you answer the door, Sensei?
You must be eager to {i}learn{/i}, right?
I need you to promise me that we won’t have to hide a body by the end of the night.
I’m obviously {i}not smart enough{/i} to pull off a murder, so I doubt that will be necessary.
Good. I’m glad you understand.
THAT WAS SARCASM, YOU JERK! I’M PLENTY SMART!
I move to the door to let Makoto in.
Right before I open it, I look back at Ami to make sure she hasn’t gone to the kitchen and grabbed any sharp utensils...
Hey. Thanks for coming to {i}help me study{/i}...
Help you study? What are you-
Oh! Y-Yes! Are you...prepared for knowledge?!
{i}What the Hell is that? Just act natural.{/i}
{i}Leave me alone! I’ve never been in a boy’s house before! I’m nervous!{/i}
CLASS...PRESIDENT...
Oh boy. Here we go.
You’ve got some real nerve showing up here, you know?!...
Oh. Hello there, Ami. I seem to have forgotten you lived here.
I don’t just {i}live{/i} here! I take care of my [uncle] here! We’re practically inseparable!
Not true. We’re pretty separable.
Is that so? Because he didn’t even mention your name when {i}inviting me over{/i} today.
Also not true. I specifically mentioned that Ami lives here and that this exact thing would likely happen.
That’s really funny because he’s never mentioned your name literally ever in the entire time I’ve known him.
That is only because you keep my mouth taped shut while I am home.
Shut up, my little pogchamp.
Sorry, Ami.
Oh? Has anyone ever told you that taping the mouth of someone you love shut might actually just make them love {i}you{/i} less?
What?!
And how your creepy obsession with your [uncle] is teetering on the verge of [incest] which, I’ll have you know, is illegal. Especially with someone who isn’t even-
Eyes up here, devil-woman.
You will look at me when I am talking to you.
Do I make myself clear?
Oh, Ami! I forgot you were even there. Sorry about that.
You didn’t forget me! You were just talking about me!
We are arguing! Forgetting me during a time like this isn’t even possible!
Wait, who are you again?
A maid? Gardener?
If you don’t mind, I’d like to be left alone with my teacher.
He and I have {i}a lot of ground to cover{/i} tonight.
You...thirsty...little...bitch...
Oh, wow. Ami’s even angrier than normal this time.
I mean, of course something like this would be bound to happen with Makoto encroaching on her home-turf...
But I’m starting to worry that the two of them might actually start hitting each other if I don’t step in.
Actually, that might be fun to watch.
Wait.
No.
I really shouldn’t let that happen.
If anything happens to Makoto while she’s here, I could get in trouble.
Makoto’s a smart girl, but I’m pretty sure that even she would have trouble explaining to her mother why she’s coming home with a black eye after {i}studying{/i}.
Sensei...
No, Ami. You can’t hit her.
NGH! WHAT IS THIS WORLD COMING TO?!
Thank you for protecting me, Sensei.
To be fair, I don’t think I’d need any protection from Ami considering her arms are essentially oversized noodles, but I thank you nonetheless.
My arms are not oversized noodles! They’re strong and ready to fight for what they love!
Come at me, wench!
Sensei, where do you keep her leash? I’m thinking it might be safer for all of us if we just chain her up for a little while.
Uhh...I don’t have a leash. Let’s see if this works.
Ami, go to your room.
No!
I have exhausted every trick known to me. I’m sorry, Makoto.
It’s fine.
I suppose it wouldn’t be the worst thing in the world if all three of us were to...study together.
All that matters to me is that I get to spend time with you, Sensei...It doesn’t bother me that we’re not alone.
And you never {i}will{/i} be alone. Not as long as I live.
Makoto...Miya-whateveryourlastnameis...We are at war.
It’s Miyamura. And I accept your declaration of war, Ami Aragofuckyourself.
Hey, wait a minute. She and I have the same last name. That’s kind of insulting to me as well.
Oh, of course. I’m so sorry.
I’d obviously never ask {i}you{/i} to go fuck {i}yourself{/i}, Sensei.
I don’t like the way you said that, Class President.
But since I’m an obedient [niece] who will {i}always{/i} do {i}whatever{/i} her [uncle] {i}wants her to do{/i}, I’ll stand down for the time being.
So go on. Study. Teach whatever it is you came here to teach him.
But know that there's no point in teaching anyone anything when we are all fated to be miserable up until the time of our death!
THERE IS NO GOD!!!!
Makoto, Ami and I take a seat at the dining room table and, somehow or another, Makoto is able to freestyle-lecture us about the American Civil War.
Why {i}that{/i} is the first thing she comes up with to solve the issue of our fake {i}studying{/i} session, I have no idea.
But it happens nonetheless.
Hopefully, she and I will be actually able to spend some time alone here soon.
But while Ami is around, I...can’t see that ever working out.
Eventually, it gets late and Makoto decides to head home.
I try to see her out but Ami pushes me away and then {i}literally{/i} pushes Makoto out of the house.
Either way, I still feel like the two of us managed to grow closer.
Even if it came at the cost of Ami yelling at me for the next half an hour after that.
{i}Makoto’s affection has increased to [makoto_love]!{/i}
